Pre-Game Insights: Babar Azam and Virat Kohli have major responsibility on many counts for the 2021 Cricket World T20 clash.
They have the ultimate test of leading their respective sides.
Babar pips Kohli by a fraction when it comes to winning matches in the T20 format.
Babar has a winning percentage of 65.21 %, with Kohli at 65.11%.
Virat (52.65) has a better batting average than Babar (46.89).
Hasan Ali is better bowler than Jasprit Bumrah but by a small margin.
Imad Wasim (PAK) and Ravindra Jadeja (IND) are effective utility all-rounders and a good match-up for the high voltage 2021 Cricket World T20 game.
India head into the game as favourites, whilst Pakistan are focusing and targeting to break the World T20 shackles.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match falling on a Sunday, one can expect many spectators in the stadium.
Global viewership will break records, especially if it is a close game.
Fans can watch the match in every territory, with official broadcasters and streaming sites from around the world, providing a LIVE feed.
Studio guests, as well as commentators, will present expert analysis, before, during, and post-match.
The mother-of-all-games is always a tense affair on and off the pitch.
Others: The rivalry continues at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium, Dubai, United Arab Emirates (UAE) on October 24, 2021.
This is the first Group 2 encounter of the crucial Super 12 match.
It is also the first match of the tournament for India and Pakistan.
Both sides go into the match with a strong squad including the perfect blend of experience and young players.
The two will also battle it out as the top batsmen from their respective sides.
The two are featuring in the same T20I match for the first-ever time.
Hasan Ali and Jasprit Bumrah can have a major contribution for their respective sides in the pace department.
Imad Wasim normally bowls at the start, hence, his spell will be extremely vital.
Jadeja will come in the middle overs, relying on a bamboozle delivery to give Pakistan trouble.
Jadeja can be electrifying in the field too, especially off his bowling, which helps his side.
With the match falling on a Sunday, one can expect many spectators in the stadium.
India goes into this match with a 5-0 advantage over Pakistan in Cricket World T20 competitions.
From a batting average perspective, which can be pivotal in the match, Hasan (17.00) dominates Bumrah (4.00).
Hasan can compensate with his batting if he has a bad day with the ball.
He can free his arm with the bat.
Hasan only knows how to smash the ball, whereas Bumrah is a typical tailender.
Babar has command and presence and he needs to fulfil that role in a batting sense and captain.
Virat went on Twitter to creatively share an image of him in a T-Shirt with the ‘Wrogn’ symbol on it.
With this being in response to whether he is nervous or not, the image had a caption reading:
“People: Big match on Sunday. You’re nervous, right? Me:”
He was alluding to the fact that India is going into the match quite confidently.
Taking this into account, it all depends on which captain makes the correct decisions during the match and handles the pressure the best.

The two are featuring in the same T20I match for the first-ever time.
The two will want to perform better than each other, especially as they play in the same match for the first time in a T20I.
Imad Wasim and Ravindra Jadeja are effective utility all-rounders and a good match-up for the high voltage 2021 Cricket World T20 game.
Imad Wasim and Ravindra Jadeja are very similar in style, which makes for interesting analysis.
Both players bat and bowl using their left hand.
They are slow left-arm orthodox bowlers who also attack with the bat.
They are matchable in terms of statistics, with each slightly having the edge over the other in two key areas.
When it comes to batting averages, Jadeja (15.50) has a small cushion over Imad (13.12).
Whereas Imad (23.09) has a much healthier bowling average than Jadeja (29.53).
Imad normally bowls at the start, hence, his spell will be extremely vital.
Jadeja will come in the middle overs, relying on a bamboozle delivery to give Pakistan trouble.
Jadeja can be electrifying in the field too, especially off his bowling, which helps his side.
